item.title: By: CL
item.dc:creator: CL
item.description: Really interesting read Mike. I'm just getting into looking at photos.sqlite, Does IOS actually store any images in photos.sqlite, as BLOBs? If so do you have any recommendations on how to extract if I'm using commandline or sqlitestudio...it's all I have at the moment.
item.content:encoded: Really interesting read Mike. I’m just getting into looking at photos.sqlite, Does IOS actually store any images in photos.sqlite, as BLOBs? If so do you have any recommendations on how to extract if I’m using commandline or sqlitestudio…it’s all I have at the moment.

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: I have this database how do I pull up the photos? Are they displayed in the database?
item.content:encoded: I have this database how do I pull up the photos? Are they displayed in the database?

item.title: By: Steve
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2019/05/02/ios-photos-sqlite-forensics/#comment-356">Dili P</a>.
Hmm. Looks like Photos.sqlite in Catalina and later has the same structure as Photos.sqlite in iOS, but different from that in Mojave and earlier. I wonder then how Photos Takeout app for Mac manages to extract albums and other stuff from Mac Photos for Catalina as well as Mojave.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Dili P.

Hmm. Looks like Photos.sqlite in Catalina and later has the same structure as Photos.sqlite in iOS, but different from that in Mojave and earlier. I wonder then how Photos Takeout app for Mac manages to extract albums and other stuff from Mac Photos for Catalina as well as Mojave.

item.title: By: Dili P
item.dc:creator: Dili P
item.description: Sorry, re. my question on Mac Photos album sequence earlier today, the email address should be as provided here. The other one has been discontinued.
item.content:encoded: Sorry, re. my question on Mac Photos album sequence earlier today, the email address should be as provided here. The other one has been discontinued.

item.title: By: Dili P
item.dc:creator: Dili P
item.description: Good read. Very useful insights! What about the database for Photos app for Mac? I can right click the Photos Library in Pictures, select Show Package Contents, and open the database (It's different in Catalina and pre-Catalina). Now the problem: If you rearrange photos within a user-created album, and then export the album into a folder on desktop, the manual reordering sequence is lost. So, Photos is obviously storing the information pertaining to the album sequencing somewhere. For the life of me, I can't figure out where. Any clues? Thanks!
item.content:encoded: Good read. Very useful insights! What about the database for Photos app for Mac? I can right click the Photos Library in Pictures, select Show Package Contents, and open the database (It’s different in Catalina and pre-Catalina). Now the problem: If you rearrange photos within a user-created album, and then export the album into a folder on desktop, the manual reordering sequence is lost. So, Photos is obviously storing the information pertaining to the album sequencing somewhere. For the life of me, I can’t figure out where. Any clues? Thanks!
